benchmark_details.name: Doc-750K
benchmark_details.overview: Doc-750K is a high-quality document-level dataset designed to support in-depth understanding of multimodal documents, featuring diverse document structures and extensive cross-page dependencies with real question-answer pairs derived from the original documents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a large-scale dataset and model for document-level multimodal understanding, enhancing the ability to integrate and comprehend information across multi-page documents.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset currently has a domain restriction to academic documents and intends to expand to a broader range of document types.

data.source: Data collected from Sci-Hub, Arxiv, and OpenReview.
data.format: Interleaved Text-Image Format and Multi-Image Format
data.annotation: Real, in-depth question-answer pairs collected and constructed based on document structure.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the similarity between model responses and ground truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in retrieving accurate and relevant information from the documents.
methodology.baseline_results: Docopilot-8B achieved a score of 61.8 on MM-NIAH, outperforming baseline models.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against multiple existing benchmarks for robustness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data processed publicly available documents ensuring no sensitive personal information is included.
